bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Austin Smith, January 16, 1953

div1.p: Hench is sending Smith information about the Camp Lazear dedication that he can forward to one of the writers for the "Journal of the American Medical Association."

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Austin Smith, January 16, 1953
div1.opener:
January 16, 1953
Dr. Austin Smith, Editor
Journal of the American Medical Association
535 North Dearborn Street
Chicago 10, Illinois
My dear Doctor Smith:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for sending me the check for $15 to cover the cost
of the wreath which was placed by Doctor Chrisman for the American Medical
Association in honor of Doctors Finlay and Delgado.

I enclose a copy of a long personal letter which I have sent to the rela-
tives of those who were honored; also certain newspaper clippings, some of
which will show how well the Cubans carried on and one or two will show you
the need for some continued missionary work to correct some persisting Cuban
misconceptions.

Dr. and Mrs. Chrisman were very charming people and we were delighted to have
them at the dedication. Two or three photographs were taken by press photo-
graphers of Doctor Chrisman placing the wreath. I expect the films to be
sent me shortly from Cuba.

I must stop momentarily my interest in this hobby and finish, within the next
three weeks, an overdue chapter on cortisone. Not until then can I rewrite
anything about the Camp Lazear dedication for you for the American Medical
Association, perhaps toward the end of February. If you think I have given
you enough information herewith that one of your writers could prepare what
you want, please feel entirely free to do so and I should be glad to review
your writer's manuscript briefly to note if there are any misinterpretations
and I can send you representative photographs for you to choose from in the
near future. Perhaps you would want two photographs - a large one of the
dedication ceremony showing the memorial, etc., with a smaller insert of
Doctor Chrisman laying the wreath. They might be fixed up and published as
one photograph.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosures
P.S.: I know that Doctor Bauer, President of the American Medical Association,
and General Lull were both involved in the decision to have the A.M.A. repre-
sented at the dedication. If you think they would like copies of the enclosed
letter I can send them each one or perhaps you could forward yours. On the
other hand, both of them are so busy perhaps they would not be interested.
